question:
(a) Draw a well-labelled diagram to show the intreral structure of the earth

(b) Describe the main features of any two of the parts shown in (a) above.
answer:
Core: Innermost layer, about 3476km wide all round, consists largely of iron and nickel, divisible into inner and outer core, found in a molten state, reservoir of minerals to the other zones.

Mantle: middle layer, surrounds the core, about 2897km thick, composed of very dense rocks, rocks are rich in olivine basalt.

Crust: Lies above the mantle, outer layer, consists of granitic and basaltic rocks, varies in thickness from place to place , divisible into 2-sial and sima, forms soil, sustains life.

question:
(a) On an outline map of Nigeria, locate and name one area noted for each of the following:
(i) tin mining; (ii) limestone mining; (iii) thermal power station; (iv) oil refinery; (v) hydro-electric power station.

(b) Describe the method of mining tin in Nigeria

(c) State four ways in which minerals are of economic importance to Nigeria.
answer:
(b) Method of Mining Tin in Nigeria:

(i) Mined through open cast operation or method

(ii) Over burden is removed

(iii) Ore bearing rock is shattered with explosives

(iv) A"monitor" is used to wash the or sluice boxes

(v) Tin wash is scooped out and heaped with a drag line

(vi) Two concentrate is sent to market for smelting.

(c) Economic importance of minerals to Nigeria

(a) Foreign exchange earner

(b) revenue to government

(c) Raw materials for industries

(d) Employment opportunities

(e) Income to miners

(f) Manpower development

(g) Growth of towns

(h) Development of infrastructure.

question:
(a) On a sketch map of Nigeria, locate and name:
(i) the Chad Basin and the Western Highlands; (ii) one important river in one of the regions (iii) one important town in each region.

(b) State three ways in which the relief and drainage of the Chad Basin differ from those of the Western Highlands.

(c) Highlight three problems of development in the Chad Basin.
answer:
(b) Differences in relief and drainage between Chad Basin and Western Highlands:

(a) Chad Basin is a.lowland region while Western Highlands is a highland region

(b) Average elevation for Chad Basin is 45-60m while that of Western Highland is 300-600m

(c) Western Highlands is underlain by metamorphic rocks of basement complex while Chad Basin has sedimentary rocks.

(d) Chad Basin has inland drainage while rivers of the Western Highlands drain into the Atlantic ocean and the Niger valley.

(e) On the western highlands rivers flow southwards or northwards while in the Chad Basin, the rivers flow north-east wards.

(f) Areas around Lake Chad are swampy while swamps do not exist in the Western Highlands

(g) In the Chad Basin river include Hadeja, Yedseram, Komadugu-Gana, Yobe, etc while on the westerm highlands they include Osun, Ogun, Moslu, Ossa.

(c) Problems of development in the Chad Basin

(i) Harsh climate

(ii) Wind erosion

(iii) Pest and diseases

(iv) Scanty rainfall (65cm) leads to low agricultural production

(v) Poor transportation

(vi) Desert encroachment

(viii) Sparsity of population.

question:
(a) On an outline map of Nigeria, show and name:
(i) the mangrove swamp forest (ii) the Sahel savanna (iii) the Guinea savanna (iv) one major town in (a)(i) and (a)(iii) above.

(b) Highlight three main characteristics of the Guinea Savanna vegetation.

(c) Outline four ways in which the mangrove swamp forest is of economic importance.
answer:
(b) Characteristics of Guinea Savanna Vegetation:

(i) Tall trees

(ii) Deciduous trees (e.g. Acacia)

(iii) Mil grasses (e.g. elephant grass)

(iv) Umbrella shaped canopies

(v) Trees are shea butter, locust bean, oil bean, silt cotton, etc

(vi) Grasses are seasonal, change colour, and wither in dry season 

(c) Economic importance of the Mangrove Swamp Forest:

(i) Wood for fuel

(ii) Wood for construction

(iii) Ropes and twines for weaving

(iii) Medical herbs, roots and barks

(iv) Tree bark for dye and tanning

(vi) Roots of mangrove trees provide food for oysters.

question:
(a) On a sketch map of Africa, locate and name:
(i) two fold mountain areas (ii) two important rivers north of the equator (iii) two ocean currents: one warm; one cold (iv) the Tropic of Cancer and Capricorn.

(b) Explain how one of the ocean currents in (a)(iii) above affect the climate and v 3getation of the adjacent coastlands.
answer:
(b) Effects of warm or cold ocean current on climate and vegetation: Warm Current:

 (i) Raises the temperature of adjacent coastland

(ii) Raises the temperature of surface waters

(iii) Resulting in high rainfall

(iv) High rainfall and high temperature give rise to dense vegetation

(v) Makes the on-shore wind to carry more moisture inland

Cold  Current

(i) Lower the temperature of adjacent coastland

(ii) Lowers the temperature of surface waters

(iii) On shore wind form fog

(iv) Low rainfall/arid condition gives rise to desert vegetation

(v) Resulting in scanty rainfall and arid conditions

(vi) Responsible for the formation of Namib Desert (cold Benguella Current).
